newsitem.title: USA: Sony eyes Rifkin to replace Canton.
newsitem.headline: Sony eyes Rifkin to replace Canton.

text.p: Sony Corp is negotiating with Arnold Rifkin, worldwide president of the motion picture group at the William Morris Agency, to take over as chairman of its Columbia Tri-Star Motion Picture Cos unit, Daily Variety reported Wednesday.
Before taking the job, which is currently held by mark Canton, Rifkin must be released from his contract at William Morris, which runs until sometime in 1997.

Canton has held the job since 1991, when he replace Frank Price as chairman of Columbia Pictures. He has two years remaining on his contract and is expected to move into a production deal at Sony Pictures Entertainment, Variety reported.
The trade paper quoted anonymous sources as saying Rifkin would go to New York this week for a meeting with Sony executives.
